Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff home run off Merrill Kelly
Mookie Betts hit a home run two pitches later
Freddie Freeman hit a first-pitch home run, giving the Dodgers their first back-to-back-to-back home runs to lead off a game in franchise history
Corbin Carroll hit an inside-the-park home run, the seventh-fastest home-to-home time since Statcast began tracking in 2015
Jake McCarthy and Joc Pederson followed with singles, Lourdes Gurriel Jr. laced a two-run double, and Eugenio Su√°rez plated Gurriel with a sac fly, giving the D-backs a 4-3 lead
Tommy Edman's tiebreaking two-run single in the ninth gave the Dodgers a second straight win
Pre-Game Insights: The rivalry sets the tone for the NL West race down the stretch
D-backs have the best record in baseball since July 1 and are known for their fight
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts acknowledged the intense and gritty nature of the game
Post-Match Reflections: Arizona (76-60) trails Los Angeles (82-54) by six games, with two games left in this series and 26 games remaining for both clubs in the regular season
San Diego (77-61) also sits six games back and isn't going away either
Even if the Dodgers hold on to make it 11 titles in the last 12 years, it's clear there will be no runaway winner in the NL West this season
Miscellaneous Highlights: NL MVP front-runner Shohei Ohtani lit the fuse with a towering leadoff homer
Kelly was encouraged that his velocity was up but still doesn't have the feel for his pitches
Carroll's inside-the-park home run was the seventh-fastest home-to-home time since Statcast began tracking in 2015
The game started with the most exciting first inning in MLB this season
